alert.note: Alert for Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 11:07PM EST until December 20 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Millstone River At Blackwells Mills affecting Somerset County. For the Millstone River...including Blackwells Mills...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Millstone River at Blackwells Mills. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, The Griggstown Causeway is closed due to flooding. At 7.0 feet, Several more causeways are closed due to flooding. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage reached with flooding now along River Road in Blackwells Mills and S. River Street in Millstone. Base of Route 533 bridge floods. River Road between Yorktown and Amsterdam is subject to closure. Canal Road near Suydam Road floods. At 10.0 feet, The D&R Canal is flooded by the Millstone River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EST Tuesday was 14.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 2.6 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.8 feet on 06/10/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Millstone River Blackwells Mill 9.0 10.7 Tue 10 p 3.8 2.8 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 700 AM EST.
